title: Kentucky Derby Bourbon Punch Recipe
description: Bourbon punch, as expected, stars bourbon. Orange juice and lemonade also make an appearance in this Kentucky Derby punch for a refreshing adult beverage.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Drinks Recipes Punch Recipes Adult Punch Recipes Kentucky Derby Bourbon Punch Be the first to rate & review! We made this bourbon punch for our second annual Kentucky Derby party. It was a hit! Not too strong, and the citrus was a great relief from the heat. Serve in a glass filled with ice. Submitted by Lionel Rondeau Updated on June 5, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Prep Time: 15 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 32 Yield: about 3 1/2 quarts Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 32 servings Base: 34 fluid ounces bourbon 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed ¼ cup lemon juice ¼ cup maraschino cherry juice 1 ½ liters club soda 1 lemon, sliced ½ cup maraschino cherries, halved Directions Stir bourbon, orange juice concentrate, lemonade concentrate, lemon juice, and maraschino cherry juice together in a pitcher until combined. Pour bourbon mixture into a punch bowl; stir in club soda, cherry halves, and lemon slices. Tips You can also make an ice ring to place into the punch bowl to help keep the bourbon punch cold. Remember, it will dilute the punch as it melts, so keep a little extra bourbon on hand to add as needed.  Ingredients needed to make the ice ring: 1 12-ounce can frozen lemonade concentrate, 1 sliced orange, 1 sliced lemon, 1/2 cup maraschino cherries. Prepare lemonade according to the package directions. Pour lemonade into a Bundt pan, a glass, or a plastic bowl. Lay orange and lemon slices in layers in the lemonade, then top with maraschino cherries. Freeze overnight. To remove the ice ring from the pan or bowl, place it in warm water in the sink until it loosens from the container. Place in the punch bowl, then pour the punch over it. name: Lionel Rondeau
instructions: Stir bourbon, orange juice concentrate, lemonade concentrate, lemon juice, and maraschino cherry juice together in a pitcher until combined.;Pour bourbon mixture into a punch bowl; stir in club soda, cherry halves, and lemon slices.
